posts.post_content: Oh wow. Just got the point of this card, a good decade later. It's a **Phyrexian** lens because it allows you to pay **Phyrexian** mana *at half the life cost*. No matter the color. Bravo, Wizards, now *that* is some forethought.

posts.post_content:
*"strictly better then spectral search light"* -ttian  
  
Drugs are bad. [Spectral Searchlight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Searchlight) used to be hilarious because of mana burn, give an opponent mana on odd phases when they could only use instant speed responses or take 1. Or, add 1 of any color to your own pool, without life lost.

posts.post_content: Why was this a rare? There's a precedent of cards just like this being uncommon ([mana prism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mana prism) and [celestial prism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=celestial prism)). A few years later [Darksteel Ingot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Darksteel Ingot) was common and it had the new indestructible ability. I could see myself being happy I opened this as my rare in an Invasion draft but not in any other situation.
posts.html:
Why was this a rare? There's a precedent of cards just like this being uncommon (mana prism and celestial prism). A few years later Darksteel Ingot was common and it had the new indestructible ability. I could see myself being happy I opened this as my rare in an Invasion draft but not in any other situation.

posts.post_content: This card is bad. It has no redeeming qualities. [Spectral Searchlight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Searchlight) can't mana burn people anymore, but atleast spectral searchlight doesn't deal damage to *you*. [Spectral Searchlight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Searchlight) also has some play value in multiplayer games.
